The answer is A, B, C. In events 12, 13, and 14, the male speaker discusses the importance of the production process and residual graphite on the quality of graphene. He contrasts the use of chemical vapor deposition on copper (event 12), which produces high-quality single-layer graphene, with natural graphite (event 13), which yields low-quality platelets. The speaker also mentions that impurities are removed during the process of making graphene (event 14), which further supports the idea that the production process plays a significant role in determining the quality of graphene.
